image.altText: Tam Goddard

props.synopsis: Pet owners would be legally required to spend a minimum of three hours with their dog every day under the proposed laws, but questions remain about how such laws would be enforced.

title.children: Should the government tell you how long to spend with your dog?

image.altText: Concept art of a sports club.

props.synopsis: The Viking Group wanted to build a $33 million club in a region with the highest rate of gambling losses per person in NSW outside of greater Sydney. Many in the community had other ideas.

title.children: 160 pokies, 50m from houses, open until 3am: New club’s plan rejected

image.altText: Youth welfare professional answers questions in office setting.

props.synopsis: The ACT Children and Young People Commissioner says including the ACT's continuous monitoring system in nationally consistent Working With Children Checks could improve child safety in childcare centres.

title.children: This ACT child safety practice could help improve national ones

image.altText: Kaeo Weekes celebrates

props.synopsis: The Storm move second on the NRL ladder by edging the Cowboys in Townsville. Earlier, the Canberra Raiders led 24-6 in the second half, but had to hang on to withstand a furious Dragons fight-back to hang on and win 28-24.

title.children: Weekes brilliance sets up Raiders win as Dragons bemoan officiating

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court heard police found hundreds of child abuse images on the 57-year-old's devices, as well as a document titled The Paedophile's Handbook.

title.children: 'Vile and pernicious': Grandfather jailed for sexually abusing 2yo

image.altText: A public bus with a wrap on the back that reads "MyWay+".

props.synopsis: Seven months since the ACT government launched its MyWay+ ticketing system, functionality issues persist and an inquiry has raised questions about its rollout.

title.children: 'Minimum viable product': Inquiry told MyWay+ commuters should've been told

image.altText: A apartment building with cars driving on a main road in the foreground.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into strata management in Canberra hears of some unit owners struggling to pay levies and ending up bankrupt with no legal protections.

title.children: 'Losing their homes': Unit owners facing bankruptcy after strata action

image.altText: A uni lecturer

props.synopsis: The Australian National University announces more staff cuts across academic and professional roles, as part of its broader goal to save $250 million by the end of the year.

title.children: 'Awful': Amelia's in an ANU redundancy pool with two close colleagues

image.altText: Brightly coloured frogs in wet veegetation.

props.synopsis: Brindabella National Park has some eye-catching new residents thanks to a Taronga Zoo breeding program.

title.children: Zoo releases critically endangered frogs into NSW national park

image.altText: Robert Bogucki, a young bearded man wearing dirty jumper and backpack, scratches his head next to water hole

props.synopsis: In 1999, a young American dumped his bicycle and walked into the Great Sandy Desert. Why was he willing to risk his life, and why do some people need to get lost in order to feel found?

title.children: Decades after he disappeared into the desert, Robert Bogucki returns

image.altText: Wallabies watch the Cibi

props.synopsis: With the first Test against the British and Irish Lions under a fortnight away, the Wallabies step up their preparations with a clash against Fiji in Newcastle. Follow live.

title.children: Wallabies start strong against Fiji in season-opening Test

image.altText: GettyImages-2223748966

props.synopsis: A victory would see Fremantle jump into the top eight but a recently improved Sydney stand in their way. Follow live.

title.children: Dockers skipper returns as side searches for seventh straight win

image.altText: A tennis player stretches out to hit a ball back over the net.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sets up a showdown with Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon, as Daria Kasatkina goes out in straight sets.

title.children: De Minaur faces mammoth Wimbledon test after victory

image.altText: Cameron Munster looks over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Queensland captain Cameron Munster is given time to grieve with his family after the death of his father Steven, but will play in the Origin decider.

title.children: Munster to play on despite death of father days out from Origin III

image.altText: Flood striken bunk beds inside a cabin

props.synopsis: Two nine-year-old campers are among dozens of people dead after river waters rose eight metres in just 45 minutes near their camp north of San Antonio.

title.children: Nine-year-old campers among dozens killed in Texas floods

image.altText: Ben O'Connor crashes with his buike in the air and the rider on the ground

props.synopsis: Ben O'Connor is a late faller on a chaotic first day of the Tour de France as two key contenders lose time after a split and two riders abandon the race after crashes.

title.children: 'Banged-up' Ben O'Connor crashes on 'crazy' first day of Tour

image.altText: Melissa McIntosh the Royal Easter Show.

props.synopsis: Senior Liberal Melissa McIntosh says parents are right to be angry at politicians, including herself, for failing to do enough to keep children in care safe from abuse.

title.children: Senior Liberal says parents right to be furious at politicians for failing children

image.altText: Silhouette of a woman's head coloured purple with small puzzle pieces falling out of the back

props.synopsis: After witnessing my mum's cognitive decline and with dementia now the leading cause of death for Australian women, I can't help but wonder: Will I be among them?

title.children: I watched my mother succumb to dementia. Will it come for me, too?

image.altText: An old Tibetan man in red robes leans over to pat a koala, held by a young girl. A blond4e woman and a small boy sit beside them

props.synopsis: To Tibetans all over the world, His Holiness is a hugely important spiritual and political leader.

title.children: The Dalai Lama turns 90 and delivers Tibetan Buddhists an answer

image.altText: empty block between concrete buildings where a building used to be with yellow earth moving equipment and trucks around rubble

props.synopsis: The death toll from the collapse of a residential building in the Pakistani megacity of Karachi grows as rescue teams work for a second day in search of survivors.

title.children: Residents heard cracking before deadly apartment collapse in Pakistan

image.altText: Australia batters Cameron Green and Steve Smith talk during a Test.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith cops a nasty blow on his injured finger, Cameron Green gets back in the runs, and Beau Webster falls in the rain. Here are five quick hits from the third day of the second Test in Grenada.

title.children: Five quick hits: Smith cops a nasty blow and rain unsettles Webster

image.altText: Virgil van Dijk and Andrew Robertson carry wreaths of red flowers in the shape of football shirts

props.synopsis: The last time many of his friends in football made the trip to Porto was two weeks prior, for Jota's wedding.

title.children: Liverpool players join mourning family at Diogo Jota's funeral

image.altText: Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra smiles and waves through a rolled-down car window.

props.synopsis: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is a photogenic, wealthy daughter of a powerful political family that has been at the top of Thai politics. But now she has fallen from grace.

title.children: The dynasty that has dominated Thailand may have run out of power

image.altText: A room full of people performing tactile Auslan and smiling

props.synopsis: Very little progress has been made on "once-in-a-generation" disability reforms since they were first announced in 2023, leaving many in the sector concerned some people could be left behind.

title.children: As the government clamps the NDIS, is this the future of disability support?

image.altText: A man in a polo shirt and a blue lanyard sits smiling at a table with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: A prominent man from Horsham, Victoria who has been convicted of accessing child abuse material held a valid Working with Children Check for years following his arrest.

title.children: Man held valid WWCC after arrest for accessing child abuse material

image.altText: Daniel is wearing a black suit with a white button up shirt

props.synopsis: The National NAIDOC Awards have wrapped up for another year. Here's your guide to the winners list.

title.children: Daniel Hunt wins coveted NAIDOC Person of the Year

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing development with a green arrow pointing downwards next to a percentage sign

props.synopsis: The decisions of the Reserve Bank's board impact the budgets of many Australians — either directly or indirectly — so it's a pretty big deal. Here's what to expect from this week's meeting.

title.children: We're expecting another rate cut this week. Will more cuts follow?

image.altText: lions lying down

props.synopsis: It's understood the woman, aged in her 50s, was airlifted to hospital after being bitten by a big cat at the Darling Downs Zoo near Toowoomba.

title.children: Woman suffers significant arm injuries after animal bite at zoo

image.altText: Tongan women in traditional dress sitting on floor holding strands of plant over a tanoa

props.synopsis: Demand for kava is growing so large in Australia that Woolworths has started stocking the beverage, known for its calming effects. But Pacific leaders say the crop's success comes with problems.

title.children: In the Pacific, 'who has kava is king' but some fear it's hurting families

image.altText: A close up shot of an older man frowning while wearing a white hat reading Make America Great Again

props.synopsis: The Department of Homeland Security says the US has deported to South Sudan eight migrants who had been held for more than a month by the US at a military base in Djibouti.

title.children: US completes deportation of eight men to South Sudan after weeks of legal wrangling

image.altText: Musician DOBBY looking off into the distance in low light, wearing a feather necklace

props.synopsis: When Aboriginal-Filipino rapper DOBBY made his ARIA award-winning album Warrangu: River Story, it set him on a journey of spiritual self-reflection. Now he's using his voice to send a powerful message around climate, racism and injustice.

title.children: How Aboriginal-Filipino rapper DOBBY found his voice

image.altText: An aerial shot of the wreckage of two grey cars.

props.synopsis: Investigations are ongoing into a crash in the small community of Bolinda on Sunday morning.

title.children: Three dead, one critical in Macedon Ranges crash, north-west of Melbourne

image.altText: A wide shot of the front entrance to Casuarina Prison, with two men dressed in blue walking out and trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the state's first recorded death in youth detention, probing more than a decade of troubles, highlighted how past progress has been short-lived and eventually seen a return to crisis. Will this time be different? WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Historic issues continue to haunt WA’s most vulnerable children

image.altText: A nighttime photograph of the eco-hut and the galaxy above.

props.synopsis: A lodging in New South Wales has become the first to be internationally recognised as "dark-sky" accommodation, where visitors can take in the wonders of a clear night sky with little light pollution.

title.children: Australia's first 'dark-sky' accommodation sparks hopes of tourism boom

image.altText: A group of people walking towards the camera, with the coroner in the centre of the picture

props.synopsis: The Yuendumu community is preparing for the coroner to arrive to hand down her long-awaited findings and recommendations into the 2019 police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Coronial findings into Kumanjayi Walker's death in custody 3 years in the making
